intro: Ziziphus xiangchengensis, commonly known as the Xiangcheng date tree, is a shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest for both ecological and horticultural studies.
